data.text: You can display thePositionstab of thePortfoliodialog box in several ways:

There are four fields --Exchange,Product,Product Type, andOption Serieswhich you use to specify the set of contracts of interest.  These are calledType-Down Drop-Downfields.  You caneithertype values in them, or click on the down arrow at the right of the field to drop down a list of allowable values, and then select from the list.

For example, to enter positions in the CME's E-Mini S&P 500 futures contracts, you would selectCMEfor the exchange,ESfor the product, andFuturefor the product type.  To enter positions in options on these futures, you would change product type toOption on Futureand then select the option series -- for example, the December 2017 options on the December 2017 future.

You can move around within the grid using the mouse, or via theup arrow,down arrow, orEnterkeys.  If you are entering omnibus account positions, use theEnterkey to move from the Total Long column to the Total Short column.
There are two "check box" fields on the Positions tab that you can use:
For a normal account, where only a single net position quantity is defined for each position, the grid will show only a singleNetcolumn.
You can use theEdit Positionsbutton on the toolbar as a quick way to open the Portfolio dialog box on the Positions tab.  This is equivalent to pressingCtrl-E.
If any other node is selected on the tree and there is more than one portfolio defined, aSelect Portfoliodialog box will display to allow you select the specific portfolio for editing positions.
